owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
Part of me wants to keep this a secret, but they've done such a great job with this it deserves to be known. If there is a nicer accommodation in the Gili's I don't know about it. Like the Hideaway, this 3 bedroom Joglo is tucked away in the middle of the island about a 12-minute walk to Scallywags Beach Club. For a family of 5 it is ideal. Fully stocked kitchen with beautiful, new stainless steel appliances and granite counter tops. Great lighting - plus a Bose home speaker with a built-in iPhone 5/6 jack. Perfect sized private pool. And the indoor/outdoor bathrooms and showers are as good as it gets in Indonesia. Plus yummy beds, bedding, linens and pillows. And the Joglo comes with its own cellular "concierge" phone which has about 5 preloaded numbers in it, any one of which will ring to various Scallywags staff who will then take care of whatever you are needing - from "room service" to more towels to arranging a water taxi. 

Perhaps a negative for some people is that there is a large mosque about 50 meters away, and the 5x daily call to prayer may be an issue, but it wasn't for us. All part of the cultural immersion. 

All in all, we love Gili Air and we love the new Scallywags Joglo. It was absolutely lovely - and a great value. We will be back!
title: New Joglo!

owner_response.text:
Hi Parker J,

Yeah, our first review on the Joglo villa, so very exciting that you gave us 5 stars. We have 2 3 bedroom private pool Joglo villas, they were a fun project & only newly finished, you were one of our very first guests to stay. The idea of having your own private oasis, not too far from the beach is most appealing & already the Joglo's are becoming popular.

Thanks very much for your huge rave review & we look forward to seeing you again soon.

Scallywags Management 
Gili Air Joglo's
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
We were supposed to stay one night,  but extended to three. We switched rooms from the regular to ruma dua (because of the extension) - they took care of our luggage and it was a smooth transition. We actually liked the ruma dua a bit better because it had a bigger and relaxter terrace outside to chill. 
The beach is indeed a couple of minutes walking from the room, but we did not mind at all. We would take everything we needed in the morning,  have some nutella pancakes and made to order eggs at breakfast and either relax on the reserved beds or explore the island from there.

Absolutely great and friendly staff!
title: Great place to stay

owner_response.text:
Hi Annemarie V,

Rumah Dua is quite quaint, the space is great & only next door to the cool swimming pool. Thanks for taking the time to write about us.

Scallywags Management 
Smugglers Hideaway Rumah Dua
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
I would highly recommend staying at Scallywags Smugglers Hideaway. The accommodation is lovely and always very clean. You have to walk less than 10 minutes to the restaurant for breakfast - but it's the best breakfast on Gilli Air so it's worth the short walk (or rent a push bike and it takes only a few minutes). We also has lunch a few times at the restaurant - great menu.
The staff are so friendly, they really make the stay!
title: Beautiful accommodation, amazing location and the friendliest staff

owner_response.text:
Hi Kirsten,

Everyone at Smugglers Hideaway is very happy you enjoyed your stay with us & we helped you have a great holiday. Thanks for your lovely review of our hotel & restaurant too.

SMUGGLERS AT SCALLYWAGS GILI AIR
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: My boyfriend and I splashed out and booked 5 nights at Scallywags whilst diving and relaxing on Gili Air...and boy we weren't disappointed! Just a couple minutes walk from the harbour, this place is a brilliant hideaway. With gorgeous, modern rooms and your own private front garden. We were first a little sceptical about being away from the beach but it actually made no difference and we like that you could escape the beach/sun and lounge by the shaded pool at Scallywags. The staff are so attentive (even saving us from a few large creepy crawlies). Breakfast is served at the beach club (5-10 mins walk) and its the best breakfast we had in Bali. Also, the free sun loungers and comfy chairs throughout the beach club are a massive bonus! Highly recommend staying here :)
title: The perfect getaway!

text:
I stayed for just over a week at Scallywags Smugglers Hideaway with my boyfriend this january. The rooms are clean, beautiful and cleaned every morning. 
Free water at the room, nice pool, great "outdoor" bathroom, great towels and most important of all - a great bed. 
We had some trouble with the water flow at the first room we were checked into, but that sure turned out not to be a problem. They immediately helped us move our stuff into another room. I can't point out enough how KIND and helpfull the staff were. 
Always asking what you are going to do, where, when ect. and always ask how it was when you get back home. It really felt like being home. If you have any questions at all, just ask the staff - if they don't know the answer, they will find out and then tell you.
It was absolutely amazing and also really romantic for a couple like us. 

The hideaway is located a 10 minutes walk from the beach and their beach club (their restaurant where you eat breakfast) but that was in fact really nice. A little walk every morning is nice and because of the distance to the beach, it was always quiet at the hotel. 

Breakfast is great - try out their banana pancakes! Yum. 

Couldn't have imagined a better place to stay.
title: Amazing hideaway

text:
Scallywags Smugglers at first made me skeptical since you have to walk a little ways into the island away from the beach but after staying there for 4 days I actually preferred it. You have your own little bungalow away from the hustle and bustle of the beach. The staff was amazing and the unit was excellent. With your own little veranda and patio area and good size for 2. The A/C which is necessary was excellent and the room very comfortable. 

The pool is a little small but then again you are on an island surrounded by beach. The breakfast is a ways away at Scallywags Restaurant and it was just ok. I am not much of a breakfast person so it didn't bother me but there are better food options on the island.
title: Little private hideaway

text:
This is a great place to stay - nice boutique look / design and very quiet even though you are really central. I didn't like the breakfast very much nor the Scallywags restaurant - there are better choices on the island. You are right next to Classico Pizza which has the best pizza I have ever eaten (and my husband is Italian) - we actually went back twice! It is run by a lovely Italian couple who have been on Gili Air for 2 years. 

The staff here were lovely and very helpful. If I were to come back to Gili Air though I would stay more towards the north side which is even more remote and quiet, although you have less choice of places to eat.
title: Great place and location

text:
Stayed here for 2 nights. 5 mins walk from the pier drop off. Quiet location despite being close to the action. Room has a small entrance area, large bedroom & good sized outdoor bathroom. 10/10 cleanliness (especially the outdoor bathroom!). Very modern and well thoughts out. Turn down service nightly with water. Also offered in the room: blow dryer, flash light, converter, umbrella, mini bar, robes, etc. The a/c is excellent in the room & wifi is a bit slow (to be expected on an island). The private pool for the rooms is quiet & clean. Breakfast is located at the Scallywags beach bar (8 min walk, 4 min cycle): buffet style including hot bar, cereals, fresh orange juice, yogurt, Balinese or Nescafé coffee. Also on offer is cooked to order pancake & egg station. Staff are excellent & eager to help always. Can also have access to beach chairs right on the water free of charge. The only possible improvement would be to have bikes available for guests (we rented ours down the street but they were a bit worse for wear).  

Great stay - highly recommended.
title: Highly recommended

owner_response.text:
Hi Eleanor,

Your recommendation & concise review is very much appreciated. And you will be happy to hear that we are in the process of organising our own Scallywags bikes for rental to our guests. We are going to have a designated area "bike shop" & bike maintenance person where all the bikes will be looked after.

We hope you visit us again in the future.

Scallywags Smugglers Hideaway Resort
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: Spacious and private rooms with everything you need, nice bathrooms (with the best shower we had in Indonesia!) and very friendly and helpful staff. The room also comes with a buffet breakfast at the restaurant (a 10 minute walk away) and free access to the beds on the beach - it all ran very smoothly and professionally, and made our stay very relaxing. Would come back again and recommend to others! The only (very minor) qualm I would have is the complimentary small water bottles provided every day - given the waste problem the islands seem to be dealing with, it would be more environmentally friendly to have a water machine in the room or lobby that we could refill bottles with, rather than producing more waste.
title: Awesome place

text:
We absolutely loved our stay at Smugglers Hideaway. The last time I visited Gili Air, we stayed in a bungalow on the beach, so I was a bit apprehensive about staying off the beach in the village. But I actually enjoyed it even more! 

We had half a dozen restaurants and mini marts within a few hundred metres - a great way to sample a range of local food. There are no restaurant facilities on site at Scallywags, but this was also not a problem for us. We really enjoyed the walk to the Scallywags beach club for the breakfast buffet (huge variety and both egg and pancake station) and the in-room mini bar was good value (although the free mineral water is limited to 1 bottle per person per day). 

I loved the pool because it was under shade cloth and therefore always cool - a boon when the Gilis can be so hot!

The staff were all fantastic - friendly, efficient and professional, leaving the rooms spotlessly clean every day. Check in was a breeze. 

You also get a free sun lounge at the scallywags beach club which you can reserve all day, and put any drinks and food on your hotel bill - super convenient!! And the snorkelling gear we hired from the dive shop was great quality and value at 45,000rp per day! And... we got to swim with sea turtles - bliss. 

All in all, a pretty perfect stay!
title: Fantastic stay!!

text: Beautiful rooms and pool area. Only downfall is breakfast is down the road 10mins away at the sister resort. But with all the time in the world it's not too much hassle. The rooms and pool are top quality.
title: Amazing resort, very private

text: Perfect place to stay. Rooms are comfy and clean, great air con, DVD player and cable tv. Short walk to beach club with fantastic vibe, beach, food and also dive centre. Staff are super friendly and helpful. Couldn't recommend this place highly enough.
title: Clean and cosy, home away from home

owner_response.text:
Hi Geogia,

That's great you enjoyed your stay with us at Scallywags Smugglers Hideaway, it sounds like we ticked all the right boxes.

Gili Air is a special place & we are lucky enough to have our beach club & dive centre right on the best beach on the island.

Make sure you come back to visit us again 

The Team at Scallywags
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: With rooms set in individual courtyards and rooms that have everything you could want, we felt this place was such a treat.  The pool was so inviting, the rooms so clean, the bed so comfy, and overall the place was so peaceful.  The staff went above and beyond too.  We didn't want to leave.
title: A sanctuary to top off the holiday!

text: Scallywags Smugglers is a little gem. It is situated away from the main port but it is only a short walk from this jetty and the main strip. Highlights is the little courtyard entrance each room has, it also has a nice small and clean pool. Smugglers is a good escape when you want to take a break from the rest of the island! Nice and quiet too. It doesn't have an adjacent restaurant so no room service etc (would be handy when you're not feeling 100%) but we didn't mind - Scallywags restaurant is only a short walk and has the added bonus of snorkelling right in front. You can hire gear next door. Highly recommend Smugglers in terms of Gili Air standards!!
title: Hidden Gem

text:
We stayed here for two nights and it is well worth the money. Staff are helpful and pleasant and the rooms
are spotless! The bathroom has an edgy twist as you go out side your room to the bathroom and is partly outside. Room is cleaned daily and to a high standard. They also have a pool available for use and breakfast down at their beach club- which also offers sun beds for your day at the beach!

Well worth a visit if you are heading to Gili Air.
title: Travels

text:
Rooms are clean and handsomely designed. We loved having a private outdoor garden and porch. The A/C worked well, the shower stayed hot and well-pressured, and the mini-bar was stocked to the gills. The room has robes, a blowdryer, and an in-room safe (no, you can't fit your laptop inside it). The indoor pool is small but pretty, but the water doesn't get particularly warm and they turn the "waterfall" off early. Boat transfers are easy to arrange, albeit at extortionary prices. The breakfast is generous, tasty, and very Anglo-friendly. Welcome drinks are made with fresh juice. WiFi was surprisingly fast and reliable.

As mentioned already, this hotel is a 10+ minute walk from the beach club. Its isolation from the main drag makes for a quieter stay, plus it puts you closer to some good restaurants (Shark Bites, Classico). The distance is only irritating when the sun is beating down and you're dragging your suitcase to/from the pier. (Staff only helped us one way; after check-out, we were on our own, wham bam thank you ma'am.)

Speaking of the staff, we were more than a little irritated by their nonstop snickering in Bahasa during our checkout. Not sure what could possibly be so amusing about paying one's bill, but we were so annoyed at their behavior, we declined to leave a tip. (Not so funny any more, is it boys?)

We recommend renting snorkeling gear from the dive shop next to the beach club, but DO NOT rent bikes from the recommended vendor near the hotel; these bikes are in terrible condition (broken seats, soft brakes, etc.). More importantly, the tires are too narrow to peddle on the sandy paths of Gili Air. You'll wind up walking your bike halfway around the island instead of riding it. My suggestion instead if you plan to circle the island on two wheels: Rent one of the bikes with the big wheels at a place in town; only the fatter tires can handle the sand.

All told, Scallywags was a mixed-bag experience. It certainly didn't help that Gili Air was a MAJOR disappointment in terms of beaches and snorkeling—the main reason we came. Most of the coral is bleached and/or broken, and I've seen more fish in tanks at Chinese restaurants than I did in two days underwater here. The beaches are shallow, loaded with sharp, crushed shells, and not particularly beautiful. In general, this island just wasn't our vibe: chill and laid-back, sure, but also filled with lots of hippies and burnouts. If we had it to do over, we wouldn't have bothered staying the night.
title: Decent Room, Lame Island

text: Really pretty location tucked away from the main front but still a really short walk. On entering through the main doors you are greeted by a sumptuous pool with sunbeds and shaded roof. The room was well furnished to a high standard, the outdoor bathroom was glorious . Having a private courtyard was a nice touch too. There was a huge selection of items in the fridge should you want. The breakfast back at the beachside restaurant had just about everything you'd want - highly recommended.
title: Hidden Gem

text:
There are lots of positives about staying in the Hideway and not in the main hotel. It is lovely and quiet and, although at first it seems like a long walk, the morning stroll to breakfast is a good way to start the day. The staff here are very helpful and accommodating, unlike those at the main hotel who were somewhat abrupt and dismissive. As mentioned by others the mini bar is reasonably priced and well stocked, presumably because there is no bar here and all food services have to be sent up from the other hotel and this can take time. My only problem with the stay was the breakfast and room service food. Breakfast always seemed to have been sitting around forever, even at 7am, with the exception of the egg stop, all other food was rather stale and not very warm. In addition the coffee with breakfast was instant or pay extra - for the price I think fresh coffee is not too much to ask for. Finally I ordered a salad from room service and it was disgusting. 
So - great hotel - lousy food.
title: Clean and quiet

text:
My partner and I stayed here for 2 nights from 2 Oct 2015 and we enjoyed it.  The hideaway is conveniently located just a short walk away from the harbour.  Our room wasn't big but it was the perfect size for the aircon unit to cool completely in a short period of time.  The room was clean and toilet/shower were in an open air room.

The staff here were fantastic, very friendly and helpful.  What we loved the most was that the Classico Italiano restaurant was literally situated just around the corner.  Their pizzas are absolutely amazing!  Probably the best I've ever had.  I also liked the small pool area just inside the gates where I relaxed in the sun when my partner wanted to sleep in a little.

The only negative we had with the hideaway was that we had to walk 10-15mins to have breakfast at the Scallywags Beach Club each morning.
title: Great Service

text: This place is by far one of the cleanest on the island, it's definitely good for those who love their home comforts!  It's a really up market back packing hotel.  I can't say anything negative about the actual hotel, the only thing i would say is that it's a little far out from the action.  which is great for getting a good nights sleep but a little far out if you want to keep going to the main strip.  Also there isn't a view at all and I have to say when I saw the other beach side villas I was envious.  Having said that scallywags is immaculate and you can't fault the service.  But for those who want to be in the thick of things this may be too far out.  I've written a review on my website if anyone fancies having a look before booking.  you can find my link in my profile :)

user_location.name: Emirate of Dubai, Uni Emirat Arab

title: gorgeous and clean!

text:
Nice rooms at Smugglers, well equipped, clean and modern. Minibar is really well stocked and not stupid price for once! Wifi is fine.

Location is ok, based in the middle of island - very close to jetty where you come in off the boat. Only a short walk to the Scallywags beach club and restaurant where you have your breakfast. Speaking of which, the breakfast was really nice. Recommend renting bicycles to get around the island.
title: Clean, modern rooms

text:
Scallywags Smugglers was a major feature of an unforgettable holiday. The cosy boutique hotel is a 5 minute walk from the main pier on Gili Air. Our walk took us through small paths flanked by local cottages with a friendly Kampong atmosphere. When we weren't sure which way to proceed the locals were quick to point the way. 

Our check in was delayed due to a guest overstaying in our room, but the manager was quick to compensate us when he heard of our inconvenience. And made sure to apologise in person. 

The room was very comfortable, clean and modern. The roofless shower was a wonderful bonus. 

It is about a 10 minute walk to breakfast at the scallywags beach club (bar and restaurant) , but we did not mind the walk.  

Scallywags residents get free deck chairs at the beach club, and access to one of the better beaches. Outsiders have to rent the deck chairs. So hanging out at the deck chairs became a regular activity for us. 

Breakfast was yummy. The banana pancakes were my favorite. 

Staff were incredibly attentive and warm, always with a ready smile.
title: Spectacular time with Scallywags

text: This was indeed a hide away. The Scallywags Beach Club is a long walk or a short bike ride away. The rooms however offer all of the western comforts we were looking for. Air conditioning, refrigerator, safe and clean rooms. There is a bike rental place next door. I highly suggest getting a bike if you stay here otherwise its a long HOT walk from the main drag. Free access to the beach club is included. We went EVERYDAY. It was the best food, beach and swimming on the island there. Make a reservation at breakfast for you chairs at the beach club. They will hold them for you all day. They sell the chairs after 10am to the public. Everything you need is at the Beach Club. Everything is quality here.  An extensive breakfast buffet is included everyday.
title: Clean hide away!!!

text: We stayed here as a couple and a couple of friends in August- September 2015.......Great staff who were constantly smiling, helpful and friendly. We had a massive lovely spread for breakfast every day and it is all delicious, there is Balinese rice and noodles, pancake, fresh fruit, toast, full english breakfast (with proper pork sausages), freshly made omelette/egg station and homemade granola and cereals with yoghurt. We are massive foodies, anyone that loves food must eat here, it is seriously soo good. The service in the restaurant is great, we were well looked after by a lovely english girl called Annabelle and her team who are always welcoming. The restaurant is genuinely some of the best food on the island and a really nice place to be in the evenings with wooden tables on the beach and candlelit dinners. They do a bbq every night that is really well priced where you can have fresh fish. The restaurant is situated right on the beach with lovely white sun loungers and sunshade umbrellas with full waiting service all day, it overlooks Lombok with views of Mount Rinjani to the left and you are right on the turquoise sea to take a dip in to cool off every now and then. We stayed in Smugglers Ruma Dua, we were two couples with a room each and the great thing about this setup is its effectively one building split into two separate apartments within its own private garden. Whilst we knew the other couple next door if you didn’t you still have plenty of privacy. We were able to treat it as our own little complex and sat out together in the garden in the evenings listening to music and drinking cold Bintang like a private villa. The swimming pool here is gorgeous, with its own tropical waterfall surrounded by plants and within a silent little oasis. I liked how all the parts of Scallywags were a little walk apart as you end up having a really nice quiet peaceful sleep away from the business of the beach area and main strip but then walking down to the beach for your breakfast. I can’t recommend it enough, a really nice place to stay, we spent our daytimes out diving with Ben who runs their dive school from Scallywags Dive, they have a great setup where you are totally looked after by the boat staff, you don’t need to lift a finger. Their fantastic divemaster Rama leads the fun dives and literally finds all the best stuff, our dives were full of turtles, peacocktail shrimp, orangutan crab, we even saw a manta ray!
title: Smugglers hotel Gili Air our trip Aug 2015

text:
Very powerful shower, beautiful designed pool, large clean rooms, good bed, food and service are excellent. Minor points; quite a walk to the beach club for breakfast and expensive for Lombok standards. 

WiFi is slow but not below par for the Gili’s.
title: Nice place

text: Lovely hideaway. Clean and comfortable rooms. Loved the semi-outdoor bathroom. Pool is very small but well maintained. Friendly and professional staff. Quite a bit of a walk to the beachfront cafe for breakfast though. Breakfast buffet selection was small but well prepared. Hotel guests are allowed to book a beach chair for free before 10am- very relaxing. In general a very peaceful and comfortable place. Would book again.
title: Not on the beachfront but excellent amenities

text: Just the place to stay really. Not a far walk from the pier, so you don't have to ride on the poor looking horse and carts (look like the poor things need a feed and not another lazy traveler on its back)  scallywags facilities are fab. Most comfy beds ever, Best bit of the beach and great food at the restaurant. All round fab experience
title: Scallywags Rule Gili Air

text:
We stayed at Scallywags on Gili T for 3 nights before getting the free speed boat over to Gili Air. Greeted by the friendly Scallywags staff on the beach, we were given a welcome drink and told to grab lounger to chill out until our room was ready. Bags were taken to  Smugglers for us and then a nice dude on a bike walked us to the place. 

Wonderful accommodation which is tucked away in the village but only a 5-10min walk from the main strip. Really clean and with a beautiful pool! Just top notch! The food at Scallywags is awesome, with a beach BBQ and all you can eat salad bar. Highly recommend this place!
title: Tucked away but brilliant

text:
Our stay at Scallywags was fantastic. We had a few issues with our room when we first arrived (construction started next door earlier than expected). We were offered a discount and a room move. Staff were there to move us from the beach room to Smugglers. The rooms were beautiful and clean (somehow - with all that sand!). The location is great - it's super quiet and in with the locals who are lovely. 

You can easily get drinks and snacks from the little houses and shops around. The pool was lovely but we barely used it preferring to head to breakfast at the beach club and then spending the day there (lounges are reserved for guests until 10am). Breakfast was delicious - lots of options with egg station and breakfast buffet 

Every interaction we had with staff was great. They were helpful and kind - going out of their way to make sure we were enjoying our stay. We hired bikes from them, got bar and restaurant recommendations.. anything you need. The managers - Annabelle and Ben - were amazing. Always interacting with guests.. helping staff. It was easy to see they love their jobs. 

I would head back to Scallywags in a heartbeat - I never wanted to leave!
title: Best staff, amazing food and beautiful rooms

text: We stayed here during a little stop in Gili Air for 2 nights. The staff are really helpful and friendly and the rooms are lovely, albeit the air conditioning wasnt working in our room. It felt very safe and secure and although its a short walk to the restaurant its well worth it - having breakfast with that view of the sea is perfect. The evening bbqs are also not to be missed! We will definitely be back.
title: Brilliant staff and lovely rooms

text:
My friend and I stayed here for a night in August and it was just what we were after. The accommodation was excellent - well kept, clean and to a high standard. I saw a complaint about the 'small pool' but when you have the ocean on your doorstep it is the perfect size for an afternoon dip. In my opinion the pool area was great - a very relaxing space. The accommodation is about 5 minutes from the harbour and yes you have to walk off the main strip but this keeps it tucked away and noise free away from the bars at night. No complaints from our side!

Smugglers restaurant is also fantastic. Breakfast is included and offers a wide selection. On the odd occasion popped in for lunch or dinner also. It is slightly more expensive than other places but well worth it. The food is of a high standard and I often found myself wishing I had eaten there on the number of times we did not.

Finally staff are absolutely amazing! Not a bad word to say. Annabelle and the team could not have made us feel more welcome and took time to get to know us individually. Real friendly atmosphere.

Would definitely recommend both accommodation and staff.
title: Absolutely amazing stay

text:
We stayed at Smugglers for 3 nights in August 2015 and loved every moment. Whilst Gili Air is the middle sized island, Smugglers very quickly became the only place for us to be! The staff were so friendly. Nothing was too much! Not even when I broke our safety deposit box with everything in it!!

The Scallywags restaurant is the best place to eat on the island. Food was fantastic and prices were reasonable. The tables on the beach were a great touch. Better still, the staff reserve your beach sun loungers for you during breakfast so there is no fighting for space! Another nice touch. Oh, and the breakfast is epic!!

The rooms were very clean and always cool when we returned in an evening.

The hotel even arranged a private boat for our onward journey to Gili Trawangan for 50,000 rupiah per person.

This is the only place you should be considering staying at if you're heading to Gili Air!!
title: Awesome rooms, awesome staff, awesome restaurant and awesome views!!!

text: Me and my friend stayed at the Scallywags Smugglers for 5 nights. We were aware of the fact that this place is rather expensive compared to other Gili Air hotels but we didn't regret going there. The rooms were clean, the staff friendly and the shower... awesome :-) The breakfast in the beach club which is a 10-minute walk away, was a little disappointing but speaking in high standards. Would go back to Scallywags anytime!
title: Not cheap but still great

text: Really enjoyed it here. Friendly staff, lovely comfortable rooms. DVD player with latest free DVDs. Nice little pool although can't sunbathe there. Get to the beach for sunbeds as they go quick! Everything is continent at Scallywags. The waiter even learnt my name for every night we saw him. Good air con. English plugs! Would have stayed longer if we could.
title: Very nice stay

text: Loved our 5 night stay here and we would have loved to have stayed longer. It's located a bit more inland from the beach but it is only a short walk from the Smugglers Restaurant. The rooms are extremely comfortable and the outdoor bathroom is fantastic. Wi-fi could be improved as the signal was quite weak but I suppose sometimes it's nice to be internet free! The staff were amazing as they were always extremely helpful and went out their way to make us feel welcomed. They even booked a private snorkeling trip for us. If I'm ever back on Gili Air, I would definitely try to book this hotel again!
title: Perfect place to stay

text: Me and my wife stayed here during Nyepi because Bali is basically shut down that day. This place is beautiful and the restaurant was good too. We're not ones to just lounge around but since there was no surf we just laid on the beach all day. This was a highlight for our one month stay in Bali. The price was very reasonable for what it is, especially on the holiday. Stay here and you will not regret it.
title: Amazing place to Stay.

text:
I was pleasantly surprised that after staying 5 nights at a 5 star luxury boutique private villa in Ubud that Scallywags was practically just as nice. I admit I had low expectations especially after walking down the dirt path to get there but the second we opened the doors it was like entering an oasis. 

Our room was pristine, had lots of space, good lighting, nice outdoor bathroom with fresh water and a rain shower and a little front deck where we left all of our shoes and sandy/wet beach attire. Our room also had a fridge and air conditioning which was appreciated and used since it's really lovely and hot in Gili Air. I was actually told by a few locals on the island that this hotel was the nicest on the island and I would definitely believe it! We had a great time. I should note that we felt very safe there and it was nice and quiet as well. I was particularly impressed that they had wifi AND HBO! I was able to catch some of Wimbledon, my favorite tennis tournament without any trouble. 
Part of our room rate was the breakfast buffet at their beach club, which is about 10 minutes away walking along the beach. Normally I can't stand buffets as the food is usually left out for hours and has flies around it. Again Scallywags beat all expectations! Their buffet was delicious! They had someone who made yummy omelets and pancakes as well. We would eat breakfast and then sit right in the beach in one of their comfy beach chairs with table service. It was ideal and I felt very well looked after. One more perk of staying at Smugglers was its close proximity to the island's best restaurant - Classico. We ate there most nights. 

I would certainly return to this beautiful island and I would most definitely stay again at Scallywags Smuggler's Hideaway.
title: Surprisingly fantastic

text: Scallywags has more than one accomodation on Gili air all managed by the same couple and all serve breakfast at Scallywags beach club. This can be a bit of a walk but totally worth it. Our room at Scallywags smugglers was an oasis of luxury and silence not far away from the harbor and many nice things to do. The design in the room is very nice and eye for detail is superb. Nice minibar assortiment and not too expensive, very comfy bed and shower in open air. Breakfast is buffet where you can order panaches and eggs to your liking. They also offer free use of stretchers at the beach and this beach is the best on the Island.
title: Amazingly comfy room and breakfast location

text: I stayed here with my sister and we both loved it. The staff are so friendly and helpful. The rooms are in the middle of the island - when you get off the boat, it's a very easy walk straight up the middle of the island and down a road to the left. The pool is small, but beautiful, although we spent all our time on the beach. The restaurant food is great, and you can use the sunbeds out in front. Definitely go to the Classico restaurant next door to the where the rooms are based, really amazing stone-baked pizzas! The room was very clean, it was quiet, and the DVD selection is great if you do fancy a night in. I would definitely recommend this place, it's a lovely little hideaway.
title: Quiet and lovely in the middle of the island

text:
This was our first time to the Gili Islands and Gili Air was recommended as a good choice - not as busy as Gili T and not as quiet as Gili Meno. Gili Air is pretty quiet but there are a few beachside restaurants/bars that give you a social fix. The food is great, particularly the bbq'd fish at the Chill Out Bar. 

We chose Scallywags Smugglers based on the reviews here on Tripadvisor. It was a great choice. Our room was very spacious and spotlessly clean. We had our own terrace area, free internet and a gorgeous outdoor shower. It felt really luxurious. 

Breakfast was at the Scallywags restaurant/bar about a 5 min walk from the accommodation.  As a guest of the Smugglers you get a free lounger on the beach at the Scallywags restaurant/bar. The staff are super friendly and have great tips on what to do on the island. 

We walked all around the island in about 2 hours (we dawdled alot) and walked to the turtle beach at the other side of the island (it took us all of 20 mins) to watch the gorgeous sunset. 

This island is beautiful and very relaxing. Scallywags Smugglers is a perfect choice for a bit of luxury at a very affordable price. When you arrive just head to Tourist Information by the port and they will point you to Smugglers, just a 4 min walk away. 

When you get to Smugglers there may not be anyone at reception - just head into the resort and walk towards the services room towards the back, someone is always there.  We had arrived early and left our luggage with the staff while we went to the beach bar for a welcome drink. We returned after about 40 mins at which time our room was ready. A quick shower and then out to explore the island. There is even a torch in the room to take with you in the evenings so that you can find your way back :)
title: A great little hideaway

photos.caption: Scallywags Smugglers - the gorgeous outdoor shower!

text:
We stayed here for four nights for our honeymoon and loved it! It's a very clean hotel witha lovely pool and the staff were extremely helpful/friendly! The restaurant was on the beachfront and served the best steaks we've ever had!

One thing I'd say is that my husband contacted Scallywags before we arrived to say we were on honeymoon but we didnt receive a little extra something to make it a bit more special. The other three hotels we stayed in for honeymoon gave us chocolate covered stawberries, flower garlands and a chocolate cake, so that was a bit disappointing but despite that we had a great time there. Its literally two mins walk from all the bars which was great for us but maybe not so great if you want a quiet relaxing break?
title: A great hotel in the middle of all the action!

text:
I stayed at "Ruma Dua" with my partner for 5 nights, the room is very private with a nice paved courtyard. The bed was slightly hard, the bathroom a bit smelly and there was a gap around the entrance door, allowing mozzies in, so we would keep it shut with a chair in front of it at night time, so no real problem.
Both front door and courtyard doors have double locks on it, giving it security.
There was also a safe in the room, as well as a small torch, which we would use at night as we cycled.
The staff were absolutely wonderful, especially Fa'i, who was always ready to help with anything and even organised two bikes to be brought to our rooms. He even found something we had accidently left behind just after we checked out and searched and found us near the ferry to return it to us!! Teriffic guy!
The restaurant is right on the beach and takes about 4 minutes of cycling to get to. Ben, the general manager was lovely and always ready for a chat or to give some advice, the rest of the staff was very helpful too.
Breakfast was included with our stay, unfortunately it always seemed to be cold and not very much variety. The cafe latte we ordered extra was nice.
Being a guest with Scallywags entitles you to free beach lounges, right out the front of the restaurant in the sand. Apart from nearly being washed away due to an extremely high tide (which was fun anyway) it is a lovely place to spend some or all of your day.
title: Adequate room away from the beach, lovely staff

text:
A nice hideaway, beautiful room with partly open shower. Very tastefully decorated, super clean and very nice and helpful staff. 
On a side note, when you arrive later than 10am at their beach, try to make a reservation for a deck chair to avoid any disappointment when looking forward to a lovely day at the beach front.
title: Quite and beautiful

text: Great place, a bit hidden in the local village with super-friendly and helpful staff. Very clean with everything you need available. We rented bikes and it was great fun (especially for the kids) to ride the bikes to the Scallywags Beachclub (2-3 min. by bike, 10min by foot). We can only recommend Scallywags Smugglers Hideaway and the Scallywags Beachclub and we hope to be back soon.
title: No shoes - no shirts - no problem

text:
10 minute walk from accommodation to restaurant/bar on beach sounds frustrating but in reality  was a good combination. Rooms quiet and peaceful so perfect for a young family like us, while the restaurant has one of the best locations on the island - lovely views of Lombok. Little one played in the sea while we took our time over an excellent buffet breakfast - better than most five star hotels. 

Bearing in mind this is a very small island, standards were very high. Staff at restaurant and at accommodation very helpful. Air con and electricity always worked. 

Looking forward to returning one day
title: Hard to leave

text: This hotel is located in the village area, which is really quaint and lovely. The rooms are nice with very comfortable beds and all the amenities you could want. There is a little enclosed garden with a locking gate. I liked the fact they had a good selection of drinks in the mini bar and also provided Berocca (Gili Air is pretty fun so you may need it) insect repellent and a torch to find your way around at night. The pool was small and smelled heavily chlorinated, I didn't swim as I was out and about most of the time. The restaurant is located 10 mins walk or 3 mins bike ride away from the hotel, which didn't bother me. I ate breakfast and it wasn't bad. I didn't have any other meals or drinks, as I found cheaper more fun places to hang out. I booked last minute and got a pretty good price on the room. The Mosque rings at 4.15am every morning and for me that was difficult. I actually liked the other quieter side of the island better and would probably stay over there next time. If you are looking for a pretty upmarket hotel on Gili Air then this is the one for you. Just be warned about the touts at Bansal Harbour in Lombok they are rip off merchants and a bit intimidating. Lastly Gili Air really sucks you in and you may never want to leave...
title: Great little place, with attention to detail

text:
We were looking for relatively new hotel in Gili Air and finally we found this hotel. 
It was far away from main road. We need to walk for 8-10 minutes to have breakfast at Scallways Beach Club. That was ok for us. The room was clean and new. The staff in the hotel was average. At the dinner time, we found a shop "Classico Italiano" to have dinner. 
The food in that shop was good and we didn't need to walk to the main road. We spent the time on the beach in afternoon time. It was very hot in Gili Air. We need to take 2 shower per day. The room provide hot water for shower.
title: New and Clean hotel in Gili Air

text:
Such an awesome little place to stay !! Was in Bali and decided to head to Gili for a quick get away ! scallywags was so lovely !! The rooms were clean and large, great aircon for the warmer days and the pool was just perfect to dip in! as there are only a few rooms here nothing was ever crowded and we felt like we had it all to ourselves.

The staff were very helpful and polite both at the resort and the restaurant. The buffet breakfast  was perfect !! The freshly cooked banana pancakes are a must have!! it was located a 10 min walk from the rooms though easy to get to and nice for a morning walk.

Once in the room it was lovely and quiet never heard the mosque or the parties that happen over the other side of the island.

Cant wait to head back and stay again !! This time for MUCH MUCH LONGER !! 

Keep up the good work guys !!
title: LOVED IT,LOVED IT ,LOVED IT !!!

text: Great little hotel tucked in the village behind the pier - 5 min walk. Smart modern rooms, helpful staff, great bathrooms, small but perfect pool, bike hire and Classico - the BEST pizza joint on the island (if not Bali) a minute away. We squeezed a family of 4 (2 small kids) into our room and it was fine. No communal areas accept round the pool though you have a small patio outside your room. Hire bikes as the sister restaurant for breakfast is a hot 10 minute walk away. The manageress of the restaurant and hotel Annie was a star, really helpful (got us a reliable babysittter one night), and the breakast buffet (and all the food) there is great. Highly recommended and excellent value. You'll struggle to find better on Air.
title: The Best Hotel on Gili Air

text:
I had such a lovely time here that it was hard to leave. The rooms consisted of a little courtyard with a terrace to sit out, a clean comfortable compact bedroom and a lovely outdoor bathroom. All with complete privacy. There is a small pool in this complex with sun beds and I had this to myself giving me peace and quiet away from the hubbub of the beach.
The rooms are located in the middle of a village with a mosque near by and it's necessary to walk 10-15 mins  to the main restaurant of Scallywags for breakfast. To me, in the morning, it was a pleasure to stroll up for food. Once there, a good buffet breakfast is on hand and as a guest of the hotel a free sunbed  is available on the beach with umbrella and towel. Food and drinks can be purchased throughout the day. 
Staff at both the rooms and restaurant could not be more helpful and friendly, and went out of their way to assist me. A special thank you to Annabel and Ben (managers) who gave me lots of advice and assistance especially on my iPad! They were a delight to meet.
Would definitely recommend this hotel which combines professional and friendly on this pretty little island.
title: My Own Special Retreat

text:
Excellent accommodation. 5 minute walk from the pier, and the restaurant is located on the beach which is about a 7 minute walk from the rooms but who cares? What you don't have 7 minutes to spare whilst you're on holiday to take a stroll to the beautiful beachfront restaurant? 
The staff were amazing both at the hotel and beach resort and at the restaurant it was the BEST STEAK I've ever had! honestly it was cooked to perfection from the BBQ. The pool is only a spa pool but if you want a swim get down to the beach. The pool area is very relaxing as well but only room for about 6 people to chill out. No bar in sight though but a very well stocked up minibar. It's a great stay!
title: Unbelievable getaway!! 5 stars!

text:
Very clean (apart from a few marks on the quilt cover) and really great staff, however the location is not the best. Off side streets of the village and in Gili Air, you really want to be by the water. 

Loved the outdoor shower and not a critter in site! Good breakfast but that's down at the restaurant, 5-10 minutes walk away, not really a problem for me but it might be for some. 

Also you can hear the mosque at 5am. It's not really loud, but still woke me up every morning. 

Would I stay again - definitely if it was beachside but given the location, I'd think twice.
title: Good but not the best location

text: What a beautiful little gem this is, clean, fresh and a sort of Hamptons meets Bali decor, gorgeous! It's a little bit tucked away and about a 5 minute walk to the beach and Scallywags restaurant but we just got organised to bring our beach gear when we went to breakfast and then once there we didn't move! There's a little pool but honestly we didn't use it the beach was just so nice. The rooms have all the mod cons and a bonus DVD player so that when it rained in the afternoons we could chill out and watch a movie! The staff are exceptional both here and at their restaurant. Overall I would completely recommend scallywags Smugglers. Oh and a good tip is to book via their website, they had an awesome deal on when we booked.
title: Hidden oasis

text:
Very nice, clean, good standards in room. Decent mini bar. Great bathroom, decent bed, good aircon. Wi-Fi was ok, pool was well looked after. This place shares a beach front restaurant a with another place (Scallywags mango) and is about a 10min walk. Breakfast is good with omelette station.
It's not located on the north east beach area as indicated by booking.com, more in the village area, central and south, close to Italian restaurant classico, about 200m north from public harbour. 5min cycle to beach or harbour.
title: Nice, but not as indicated in the map

text: We got a really good deal for the night as it's low season. The rooms are beautiful. Spotlessly clean. Theres a lovely pool which we had to ourselves as there was hardly any guests when we were here. Staff are friendly and when we moved to the scallywag motel down the road to save a little money they offered to carry our bags down for us. Buffet breakfast is varied and really nice. Another bonus is the DVD player in the room and the choice of modern DVDs to borrow from reception. Would definitely stay again. It's not on the main beachfront strip but a nice walk through the village will lead you there.
title: Beautiful

text: We stayed at smugglers for 4 days recently and found it hard to leave. The rooms were of a very high standard for the price and the bathrooms were second to none with a shower under the stars...! The staff were really friendly and dinner was great every time.
title: Great value for money, amazing rooms

text: Visit their website for best prices. Nice shower, friendly staff, good DVD collection. Strong Internet. Overall nice Ambiente and tasteful design. Absolute recommendation especially with off season discounts
title: Best place in gili air

text:
We stayed in the 1 room that they have next to the restaurant, right on the beach. Its a weird layout as you walk through the bathroom to get to the room, but it was very nice. Newly decorated + the bathroom was really cool - open air and had a tree growing in it!

A stay here included use of the beach loungers (which saves you 50k each!) - this is great as its probably one of the best bits of beach on the island. 

The included breakfast buffet was good, lots of selection + eggs cooked to order. 

Only downside was that on one of the nights we were there the bar next door decided to have a beach party until the early hours, which was pretty loud in the room. But this was just 1 night.

Would definitely recommend a stay here - but please note this review relates to the 1 room they have next to the restaurant & is separate from the other rooms.
title: Great stay - we had the room on the beach..

text:
We stayed at at Scallywags Smugglers for 2 nights.
After coming from Gili T, this place was great for relaxing.

The rooms were very clean and the bed extremely comfortable.

It is not located on the beach, but the 4 minute walk from the pier takes you past the locals houses and it is very peaceful. 

We spent most of the day hanging out by Scallywaygs beach club which has good food and sun loungers for free (if you're up early enough to grab them).
Even though smugglers hideaway is only 4 minutes from the pier, it is a good 15 minute walk (if not more) from the beach club/restraurant. This isn't much of problem, but you won't to be  going back and forth to your room several times a day - you become good at planning and bringing what you need for the day once you leave your room!

Would definitely stay again.
title: Great rooms

text:
We stayed for 2 nights.
The location is far 10 min walks from restaurants and beaches but is easy to rent a bicycle.
The rooms were clean, not perfect, but bedsheets and towels were all stained. 
The wifi didn't work well, on the second day we were unable to surf.
The breakfast was at Scallywags Beach Club and was not a good experience, because  on both days there were so many dirty plates, glasses and cutlery!
The staff was always nice and friendly, but in my opinion the management need to improve.
title: They could do better

text:
I stayed here for 10 nights. I'd highly recommend it, very silent, clean, big rooms, nice staff. We rented bikes and it's just a short ride away from the beach (corals and fish just off the shore) and the Beach club, which is the best on the island. Clean beach, sun beds, awesome food (we ended up having breakfast lunch and dinner here after trying a few paces around, this was the best!).
will stay here if i ever go back again!
title: Great Place very nice staff

text:
Unfortunately not what we expected. Quite far back from the beach and a fifteen minute walk to the restaurant through dirt and chickens. The room was spotless and modern and the outdoor shower was great, also great aircon and well stocked mini bar. But there were no windows in the room except out to the little patio giving it a hemmed in feeling. The pool area was ok but the pool itself is too small to swim in. See separate review for restaurant which was underwhelming. 

Gili Air in general not what we expected. Busy, over touristy, dusty and lots of rubbish on the beach. Development happening everywhere you go. Not relaxing.
title: Not on the beach, no windows in room

text:
We stayed at Scallywags Smugglers Hideaway for 2 nights and it was great. The staff are extremely friendly and welcoming. The hotel is small but very clean and beautiful. The rooms were stunning with great air con and the beautiful outdoor bathroom was a treat! The hotel is about a 10-15 minute walk to the Scallywags Beach Club but it's a very easy walk and if you rent bikes it only takes a few minutes (it costs about Rp. 40,000 per day per bike, and definitely worth it). If you want peace and quiet, it's very relaxing to just lay on a lounge and soak up the sun by their beautiful pool.

Breakfast is included at the Beach Resort and there are a lots of different options... pancakes, eggs, bacon, mushrooms, tomato, sausage, fruit... all which were delicious!

Overall, this was a great hotel to stay at and if you are visiting Gili Air, we would definitely recommend it!
title: Beautiful Hotel with Wonderful Staff

text:
Last year I stayed in this accomodation and this year I went back again.

This year we stayed one night at Scallywags Gili T and 2 nights at Gili Air. 

In fact, for Gili Air this year I booked at Scallywags Mango Retreat but we felt its room was too dark for us , hence we moved to Scallywags Smugglers. 

Yes it is not located on the beach, but in kampong. Anyway we felt homy and comfortable with the surrounding hotel.

The hotel staff helped us with renting bikes so it was easy for us to go to east and west beach. 

Hotel has genset just in case the power is off, as it happened quite often in Gili Air

The manager , Myra, was very friendly and had a personal taste of handling guest. She even gave us a handshake when we left Gili Air using Scallywags boat.
title: Nice place in Gili Air

text:
Service can make or break a hotel and Scallywags is certainly made by the people who run it. The team here and at the beach club are friendly, helpful and most of all fun.

The rooms themselves are clean, comfortable and very private- great aircon and brilliant amenities, easily some of the best on the islands. The beach is a couple of minutes walk away which gives the rooms the privacy that a lot of the rooms right on the beach don't have - the beaches are all public here!!

I will return here, it's the perfect place to chill out and relax whilst also having loads of activities available if you want them! Thanks to all of the team for making sure I had such a great time.
title: Excellent, comfortable island retreat

text:
We have stayed 3 times before at Scallywags and they were all good. This time it was terrible. 

We arrived at the reception were there was nobody, after texting them someone came. No warm greetings, no welcome drink, not even asking how our trip was. Not how we are used to being greeted in Bali. 

We were the only occupied room in the hotel, the room itself was ok, but not very clean.

We went to the pool and within 30 minutes we were bitten by insects. Also the pool and the pool beds were dirty. Instead of staying 5 days as planned we left after 1 day. We complained at the reception but they just said take the complaints to the company were we booked the room. 

Not recommended
title: Dirty and a lot of insects

owner_response.text:
I'm very sorry for this experience at Smugglers Hideaway as this is not an acceptable standard.

We have implemented new pest control precautions and cleaning schedule of pool area to ensure an experience like this cannot be repeated.

We do hope to see you again so we can reproduce the good times spent with us at Scallywags.

Sincerely, Management

text: My mum and I had booked a room at the smugglers hideaway on Gili Air, my brother decided to join last minute and when I looked it seemed that the villas and rooms were booked so I asked if they could put another bed in our room which they happily did. When we arrived we realised it was very quiet and they actually had more rooms available so he moved into a room next door. The rooms were lovely, spacious and clean, but the walk down to where breakfast would be each morning was a little far (about 10 mins) We were then told that they had some beach villa available so we moved into a family beach villa. The beach villa's are a little bit smaller and seem a bit older, there wasn't a wardrobe to hang clothes so we hung them on the curtain rail, which wasn't ideal and the mosquito nets had a few holes and gaps, but the villas are closer to the beach and food! The thing that make this place so amazing is the staff and the food! We ended up eating here every night because the BBQ was SO GOOD! The staff were so helpful when we moved from smugglers to the villas, carried all our stuff for us and were constantly making us feel happy and comfortable. I would definitely recommend staying here if visiting Gili Air!
title: The staff and food make it!

text:
We had originally booked into the Mango retreat which is about 5minutes walk from the beach. Unfortunately this was shut due to damage after the recent earthquake. We were upgraded to one of their beach bungalows - absolutely amazing!

The beach bungalow was clean and had more outdoor space than indoor space.

It was lovely to have breakfast on the beach but this was a unique experience where you order off the menu but no one tells you how many dishes you can have and we weren't told you could have juice on our first morning. Breakfasts varied significantly, portions were massive on our first morning (also my birthday but no decor or any greetings from staff), the second morning the portions were tiny, we left hungry.

The sea was full of very sharp coral and was difficult to swim in. I can imagine that during peak season the sunbeds go very quickly, we were lucky to have a choice of beds first thing in the morning.

Overall, nice hotel, great location, seems a bit hit and miss at breakfast.
title: Little gem

text:
We booked this accommodation based on the reviews on trip advisor. The rooms are very nice behind a locked door lies a private veranda before you enter your room. It is quite a long walk to the beach club for breakfast. The staff are very helpful and I would have giving it a higher rating had it not been for the fact that there is zero possibility of a good nights sleep at this hotel. The rooms are very close to the mosque and customers should be made aware that on Gili Air it is not just a call to prayer it is the full prayer service blasted out so loud on the speakers that it distorts the sound. It lasts well over an hour, sometimes close to two and when the first prayer of the day is early morning it is not conducive to sleeping. It starts at 0440hrs and goes on until at least 0600hrs - the evening one is longer but not so much of a problem because of the timing. 
Whilst I understand the hotel can not control this it nevertheless effects the customer experience and therefore my review. I have travelled vastly and have been to other Islamic countries where the call to prayer ,although within the same timings , is a call to prayer alone but this is unbearable when you need to get at least a few hours sleep. A terrible shame as otherwise this would be a great hotel.
title: Poor location

owner_response.text:
Hi Vachim
We appreciate you taking the time to write a review, however as you mentioned this is totally out of our control regarding the Call to Prayer.  We embrace the local culture and and appreciate that the religion in this region is a part of daily life here on Gili Air.  We are disapointed to see your review though mentioning something that we are unable to control!  Customers are made aware upon check in that this may cause disruption for some guests.  We will remind our staff to ensure that all guests are informed prior to check in.

Regards
Amanda
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
Definitely loved my stay. I booked the Superior Room (Rumah Dua), it has private terrace, private entrance, really the best choice for you who needs quiet moment.
I chose this room because it's not a "traditional" type of room, instead it is more minimalist and modern. Room is cold and have good air circulation -- which is perfect for a cool down after being sweaty outside.
Breakfast is well-made western and local food, tasted awesome especially the sausage. They also have bicycle rent service, with a bigger and thicker tire which make it easier to paddle on sandy road. 
Overall, it's 8.5 / 10. It's indeed not located by the beach, but at the same time it's a perfect place to hideaway.
title: Perfect hideaway

text: We booked a night at Scallywags Smugglers last minute when we decided to extend our Gili Air stay. I would recommend the larger room option like we had. text: Bed super comfortable. Loved the small private courtyard. And used the small pool every day of our weeks stay. Breakfast on the beach was really great and we made full use of Scallywaggs own loungers on a nice part  of the beach

text: Our family of 6 stayed at the Smuggler Joglo2 for 6 nights.  Our experience at this villa was wonderful.  The staff was  so attentive to our needs.  There was even a phone provided so we could call them if necessary!  We had some problems initially with the wifi connection but each time we called, someone was there within minutes to try and rectify the problem.  The villa is very private with a small, lovely pool and the rooms are simply but nicely decorated. text:
We enjoyed our recent 4 night stay here, rooms are new and clean. Icy cold air con and good wifi. Pool is small but looked nice, we didn’t really use it as we were too busy exploring the beaches. Located a short stroll from the harbour down an alleyway, which suited us as it was quiet :) Staff are lovely and  friendly and super helpful. Room also has a private balcony/garden which was awesome. 
 
You have to walk or cycle (you can rent bikes from the hotel for 50,000 rupiah per day, yes they have seen better days but they do the job!) to breakfast, but it wasn’t a big issue for us. Food at breakfast was okay, the pancakes were a winner! Coffee also not bad :)

For the price we paid it was excellent value. Would definitely recommend for anyone travelling to Gili air!  My only issue was the cidomos (horse and cart) by the ferry harbour.  The poor horses looked completely exhausted and dehydrated. If you are an animal lover it can be hard to see, it actually put a dampener on the trip for me, but obviously no fault of the hotels!
title: Great boutique style hotel

owner_response.text:
Hi NatashaSMxx,

Thank you for taking the time out to share your experience with us, we really appreciate it. We are very happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. 
We do have a bike man that works his magic on all of our bikes, but we are so exposed to the elements, sometimes it does get a little bit tricky. We appreciate your feedback and will definitely work on it.
We hear what you are saying about the cidomos, and we are on the same page. Fortunately, we are involved with the local eco trust on the Gili islands, where we strive to help provide the best living conditions and standards of care for these horses as possible while still understanding that the locals rely on the horses for income and that they are a tradition handed down through generations.

Take care for now and we hope to see you back soon.

Best Regards,
Lexy
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
I enjoyed my stay here. It was just what I wanted for a few days of peace and quiet while traveling around Indonesia. First off, I chose this location because it is a short walk from the ferry port which was crucial as I did not want to haul my luggage a long way, but also did not want to use a cidomo. I took the public ferry from Bangsal and arriving here was a breeze. 

This is a small property tucked away on a side street. It was peaceful and quiet. I often had the pool to myself! Yes, you will hear the call to prayer from the island's mosques at ~4am every day, but this is part of being on the Gilis and it makes the experience unique. I have read reviews of various properties complaining about this, but I think that no matter where you stay on the island you will hear it because there are loud speakers everywhere. 

The room I had was immaculately clean with powerful AC and fairly reliable WiFi. I loved the outdoor rain shower. There are also books/DVD's at reception for some evening entertainment if you don't feel like going out. 

The breakfast buffet was quite good. Yes it is not on site and you have to walk 10 minutes to the beach, but this is not an island where you should be rushing from one place to another, so it was fine for me. The beach club was great with towels, lounge chairs, great drinks/snacks. Just next to the hotel, there is an Italian restaurant which I did not get a chance to try but it looked very nice. There's also a little warung "Firda" which is cheap and good for a simple lunch (actually their WiFi was the fastest I found on the island). 

This is a great place to stay on the island and suitable for solo travellers, couples, and families alike. They really cater to everyone.
title: Amazing quality and value

text:
Service: loved the free welcome drink (variety of choices - I went for a cold diet coke) after a long bus and boat ride. The staff were nice and helpful - giving us a map and explaining where we can find sunrise/sunset etc. 

Location: the hotel is a 15 minute walk to the restaurant which has breakfast and sunbeds, so you have to hire a bike which is 50,000rp per day. The main issue is that the cycle at night is dark and would be quite spooky if you were alone - it's very difficult to see and lots of potholes in the floor. There is a great Italian just 1 minute away called Classico Italiano which I recommend for their amazing oven-baked pizza. 

Room: the room was clean and spacious, the mini-bar was amazing - fully stocked with lots of drinks, snacks and handy bits (e.g. mozzie repellent). Wifi was very temperamental but this is expected in the Gilis. 

Restaurant: the breakfast was fab - lots of variety. We also had lunch and dinner - it wasn't the cheapest of places but the food and service was great and right on the beach. Both my friend and I had Bali Belly immediately after our stay here, however we can't 100% say this was Smugglers fault... 

Pool: we didn't sit by the pool as it was covered, looked alright though. 

Overall: really enjoyed our stay and I don't think much better could be found elsewhere on the Gilis
title: Good stay
